original: Kleberg, John Gillis, polismästare, Norrköping, f. 25/12/99 i Gbg av hds-skriv. John K. o. Karin Anderson. G. 29 m. Margit Reuter. Barn: John f. 30, Märta 32, Klas 36, Anders 41. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 18, jur. kand. i Sthlm 27. E. o. not. i Svea hovr. 27, i Sthlms rådhusr. 27-29, e. o. tj:-man i ÖÄ f. polisärenden 28, aman: i ÖÄ 32, tidvis förordn. som not., stadsfi-skal, polisass., polisdom. o. po-lissekr. där, v. krigsfiskal v. särsk. krigsr. i Sthlm o. v. kustflottan 33, po-lismäst. i Norrköp. sed. 34, tillika luft-sk :chef där. Tjg. v. omröstn :kom-miss. i Saar 34 o. 35. Stud. polisväs. o. luftsk. i uti. Led. av RLSF arb:-utsk., led. av styr. f. Motormännens riksförb., Sv. poli&ens idr :förb. m. m. RVO, RFinlVROlkl, FFrK3k;l, FPftjk, FSftjk, 3 GM 2 SM m. m.
translated: Kleberg, John Gillis, police chief, Norrköping, b. 25/12/99 in Gothenburg, son of hds-writer John K. and Karin Anderson. Married on 29 with Margit Reuter. Children: John b. 30, Märta b. 32, Klas b. 36, Anders b. 41. — Studied at Gothenburg high school of Latin in 18, received a law degree in Stockholm in 27. Deputy notary public at Svea Court of Appeal in 27, at Stockholm City Court in 27-29, acting officer in the Civilian Defense for Police Matters in 28, assistant officer in the Civilian Defense in 32, occasionally appointed as a notary public, city prosecutor, police assistant, police judge, and police secretary there, war fiscal at special military court in Stockholm and coastal fleet in 33, police chief in Norrköping since 34, also air defense chief there. Served on the Saar plebiscite commission in 34 and 35. Studied police administration and air defense abroad. Member of the Royal Life Saving Society's working committee, board member of the Motormännens riksförbund, Swedish Police Sports Federation, and more. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa, Finnish Order of the White Rose of Finland 1st Class, Swedish Red Cross Gold Medal, Swedish Weightlifting Federation Gold Medal, and more.

awards.name: Finnish Order of the White Rose of Finland
